data.title: Great pizza, but had to wait
data.text:
We were there approx 8:30pm on a weekday night to watch the last Cubs game on TV. They were not that busy. The server took 10-15 min to come to the table to take our order and then the pizza came an hour after we put in our order. Of note, a table seated after us received their pizza 25 min before us! The only saving grace was the quality of the pizza...it was fantastic! 

Fox's...you need a better more consistent service and you will be an excellent establishment!

data.title: Pizza delicioso
data.text: We had amazing pizza here. The crust is perfect amd the cheese is fresh. The red sauce is just right. Fries were good and beer was icy cold.

data.title: Golf ball mulligan
data.text: My husband, myself and another couple went out for pizza on a Friday night.  Last year our friend had received a golf ball from a golf outing that entitled him to 50% off pizza.  We went to Fox's last night and ordered drinks, appetizers and the largest pizza they make.  When we received our bill, we showed our waitress the golf ball and she said okay I will be right back with your bill.  When she returned she said that unfortunately the promotion is only good Sunday through Thursday evening.  We challenged her and asked her to please ask her manager because we have never ever had this problem before.  The manager returned to our table and said he had only been working there 3 months but that was the policy and there was nothing he could do.  Needless to say, we were ALL disappointed.  We felt that he should have at least honored it the one-time and then in the future we would know about the new restrictions.  After we had paid our bill, sometime later, the director of operations, Jacqueline, came to our table and apologized and said she would fix our bill but we had already paid.  I'm not sure that we will be returning.  It's unfortunate because last year we dined their quite often but this incident has left a bad "taste" in our mouths.  There are a lot of other places in Orland Park where you can get pizza.

data.title: Not the same
data.text:
We had not been to this restaurant for awhile and stopped for lunch and was not impressed.  The waitress was friendly enough however had to ask repeatedly for things we had ordered.  The corned beef used to be wonderful.  Mine came and it was chewy, fatty and no taste.  The cabbage tasted old and the carrots were mushy.  I sent it back to warm and it took forever and came back lukewarm.  We ordered the soup and pizza the pizza came out with no soup when questioned the waitress said oh no problem I will go get it now.  So now the pizza would be cold.  Menu very limited so not sure why it first took so long to get our food and second why it came out cold.
Probably will not go back. Too bad because the pizza is pretty good.

data.title: not the same
data.text: we ordered foxs and nothing we wanted was in stock.  we were told we had an old menu the recording playing, as we were put on hold several times, was advertising the same things we were trying to order.  the menu online was the menu in our hands.  yet 5 main entrees were unavailable.  what we did receive was smaller portions and lower quality.  i understand prime rib is fatty but not by 50%.  the pizza was lousy too!

data.title: Good pizza, good experience
data.text: We went as a large group and were seated immediately.  The server was very pleasant and helpful and was very attentive.  We had a plain cheese and a sausage and onions pizza and we enjoyed both.  Others had to order entrees and they were also good.  I would recommend visiting Fox's when you are in the area.  If you found this review helpful, please indicate so by hitting the helpful review button.  Thank you and enjoy.

data.title: They have changed! Not for the better!!!
data.text: We have been going to Foxes for as long as I can remember and I love it. Last night they had different menus, with less than half of what was on it before, and the prices went way up, and they took away happy hour and many specials. the service and pizza are great. But $9.99 for 6 mozz sticks is over the top. Everyone around the bar was talking about how bad it is now, and filling out comment cards. Several wait staff were telling all of us, how many complaints they are getting, and how nusiness is way down. We will go back but not for awhile,and if nothing changes we are crossing it off the list!

data.title: Best thin crust pizza
data.text: This was the third time I've been taken here by a family member while we were visiting. I love the thin crust and taste of this pizza. I noticed my cousin always orders (well cooked). Perhaps the extra time contributes to the crispy crust. Winner! We had a plain cheese, a green pepper, and a sausage pizza. All were good. The place is noisy and busy. On certain nights, there is a balloon man and a magician. We saw the magician, he did a trick at our table for a tip. We enjoyed that. Many people order and drive up to pick up and take home pizza.

data.title: O.K., BUT...............................................
data.text:
Nice atmosphere, plenty of parking and prompt attention.
This was our first time at this Fox location although we have enjoyed their other restaurants.  
The lunch menu was very limited. We had corned beef sandwiches which while lean were very tough and "chewy". Service was friendly and attentive.
We have eaten at several other Fox locations and were disappointed in this one.

data.title: Top Notch Thin Crust Pizza and More
data.text: If you love a crisp thin crust pizza, you'll love eating at Fox's Orland Park. But pizza is not the only thing Fox's does well. Their sandwiches and dinners are tasty, too. A large bar dominates the main dining room but there are private rooms also available for parties and get togethers. With its varied menu and delicious pizza, everyone in your group should be able to find something delicious to eat.

data.title: Good
data.text:
Good food, full bar.
 No Wi-Fi .
It's a good place to be.🍻🍷
Live music sometimes.
Great discounts always coupons.
For sure it's worth the visit.

data.title: Review of Pizza only!
data.text: I've eaten at the restaurant a couple of times, but this review is strictly on their pizza.  I LOVE LOVE it!  Whenever I'm in Chicago, this is a must have for me.  Most of the time...we order pickupand carryout.  Thin Crust & plenty generous on toppings.  Quite pricey though for the sizes.  A family size with 3 toppings is about $40!  Three very hungry adult can finish the FAmily size.  However, I don't care as I love it a lot.

data.title: Regular Stop
data.text:
Order a pizza or have a sit-down meal and it's all good.
Nice selection of sandwiches to choose from and the bar is a nice stop as well.

data.title: great place for niece's & nephews & me to go too!!
data.text: took my niece's & nephews there my brothers death in November..good service, great pizza & drinks, sandwiches were ,good prices also very good, good variety of food & lots of it..

data.title: Worst experience ever
data.text: Food that we actually got was good but.....my husband did not get his food. Waitress apologized. 20 more minutes went by, my parents, 2 year old son and I finished our food, no food for husband. Wrong potato for my dad. But things REALLY got bad when management got involved and it took 45 MORE minutes for them to figure out what to do while my son got totally antsy and my husband starved. Their solution? Comp husbands food. That's it. Owner/manager actually snapped on me. Meanwhile, waitress had my dads credit card for like 20 minutes while we stood uncomfortably waiting for them STILL to figure out what to do. The final solution was to take $40 off for a 2 hour lunch ordeal that should've just been comped. Any respectable business that cares about serving its customers would've handled the entire situation differently. Really sad that a place with such good food would be so poorly managed. We WON'T be back.

data.title: Not St. Paddy's Day!
data.text: The food was awesome as always, but our group went to hear Irish music for a St. Patrick's Day celebration.  They advertised daily Irish festivities, but the singer performed only 5-6 Irish songs in three hours! He was good, but, if you want Irish music, Orland has many other places to choose from!

data.title: Always delicious food and service with a smile!
data.text: We go here frequently for a small pizza well done (my big tip for a crispy crust!) and are never disappointed! Sunday's can be very quiet but last night was hopping! We were still able to get seats at the bar where we always enjoy great service. Plenty of room for large families and groups looking to grab some great pizza and sandwiches. People rave about their corned beef and cabbage dinner.

data.title: pizza is awesome but the perch is the best
data.text: we have loved the pizza...  best thin crust you will ever have///  but tried the perch dinner -  it is so good  the light pan fry was to die for

data.title: Great family restaurant.
data.text: Our favorite place for Pizza. Great corn-beef and cabbage and Friday night fish fry.  Enjoy the entertainment and daily specials.

data.title: Good food, good service!
data.text: Saturday evening with no reservations and still able to get a table for four in the dining room.  Excellent menu choices, large variety.  Always good food.  Good service and nice atmosphere after remodeling.
